poem:
"Indictment in Red and Blue"

In the hushed rows of democracy,
a specter, 23, plucked from the heaving masses.
Charged with the stone-fruit hues,
of chaos and disorder.
Rubio and DeSantis, draped in her shadow,
A floridian tango of ties and turmoil.

Her name, an echo, against the Capitol's cold, marble pulse.
January 6th - the garden ripened
and overripe, fell.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Republican activist with ties to DeSantis and Rubio indicted over January 6 A Republican activist with links to Florida’s Republican senator, Marco Rubio, and its governor, Ron DeSantis, has been indicted on charges relating to the 6 January 2021 storming of the US Capitol in an attempt to overturn Joe Biden’s presidential election victory. Barbara Balmaseda, 23, has been charged with five counts of being involved in the riot, including obstructing an official proceeding, knowingly". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

Barbara Balmaseda, 23, has been charged with five counts of being involved in the riot, including obstructing an official proceeding, knowingly
